website_summaries.verdict: An affordable spare tire carrier that fits most tires and trailers, though it doesn't include all the pieces you'll need to install it.
pros: Holds 8-15 inch tires with 4- or 5-lug rims
cons: Doesn't come with the nuts needed for installation, so you will have to purchase them separately

customer_reviews.title: great idea
customer_reviews.text: so i had been confused on how to put this on my boat trailer with the tire for quite some time. there was no directions at all. i found the best way to install this onto the boat trailer was by having the tire rest on top of the trailer then going from the bottom up threw the rim then screwing the latches on. i have took a picture of what i did so others dont get confused
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Great easy product
customer_reviews.text: These are super simple and really great. I decided to drill two holes in my trailer frame and run this through them. They fit super tight and hold my spare completely up and out of the way. Excellent easy product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: GrimmRoper

customer_reviews.title: Pretty straight forward
customer_reviews.text: I used it to mount my 12" 5-hole spare tire horizontally at the front of my trailer (just under the bow of my boat). Easy install and seems sturdy enough. I didn't lock the tabs together, and the hardware is a little awkward to spin off and on quickly so I probably should have just used wingnuts or lug nuts. Nice to know I can lock it if I want. Hopefully it holds up to the saltwater.
customer_reviews.author: J T

customer_reviews.title: Dead simple spare tire storage
customer_reviews.text: I used to keep my spare for my trailer in my front hold, then would toss it into my truck when I arrived. I wanted to keep it on the trailer, and this very affordable product allowed me to mount it to my ez-loader 1214 in about 5 minutes. It takes a padlock of some sort to keep the holders from walking back, but I want to lock my spare anyway. Unless this product fails catastrophically in use I am very satisfied with how it works. We'll see how it holds up to a long boating trip.
customer_reviews.author: imakesushi

customer_reviews.title: Product works fine, especially with the spare tire mounted horizontally on ...
customer_reviews.text: Product works fine, especially with the spare tire mounted horizontally on tongue, and keeps it close to the trailer. Using with 12" tire. No bolts necessary; just a padlock to secure if desired. Not as foolproof as a heavy-duty mount, but would still require hacksaw/large cutters to compromise. If someone needs the tire that bad..
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to install in two minutes. The square U bolt fits around the trailer tongue from the bottom with the threaded ends facing up. Slide the ends of the U bolt though two of the wheel lug holes on the spare wheel and tire assembly, and screw the two threaded brackets onto the U bolt. The spare tire rests on top of the trailer tongue. I used a carabiner clip to help prevent the brackets from possibly coming loose.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Player

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. I re-worked an old trailer that didn't have a spare and used this to mount it to the front of the trailer box. Good design and very secure. My only recommendation would be to 1) oil the threads so you can remove it later if/when needed, and 2) maybe don't use a lock if you aren't worried about theft. A carabiner really works fine, just something to secure the two ends. But it's a great design and I highly recommend it. My spare size was 205/75/R15
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: ive only ever seen these type with the arm type nuts on trailers built with them on. they work great. no wrench needed to remove them. i suppose it would be nice to be able to lock it if you ahve a trailer with bling wheels, but a zip tie works fine for me. whoever says it doesnt come with nuts or you need lugs or whatever is an idiot. the bent metal things have threaded holes. like awkward wing nuts.
customer_reviews.author: wezzz

customer_reviews.title: Attwood U-Bolt Sytle Tire Carrier ...
customer_reviews.text: Did what I needed plan and simple. I used this on a pipe top utility trailer to secure the spare tire to the trailer and securely locked in place. While the photo may not make sense as to how it attaches to the trailer and how the lock it self works, it does so very well. The design allows it to be used in many various mounting situations and with almost any well bolt hole pattern. Great solution to a trailer owners security needs. Not to mention a bargain price, simple installation and Amazons fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: JVJ

customer_reviews.title: Great little product
customer_reviews.text: Great little product. Does the same job a lot of the bulkier tire brackets do, but for a fraction of the cost and weight. Even lets you secure the spare with a lock. I would recommend that this come with 2 washers, so when the brackets screw down tight, they do not bite into the steel and shave into the galvanized or painted surface of the metal wheel. Would also be nice if this came in galvanized or aluminum or stainless steel, not just zinc coated steel.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mount
customer_reviews.text: This spare tire mount is awesome, bolts right to the trailer, holds the tire securely and is cleverly designed to accept your lock. Exactly what I needed for my jet ski trailer to make use of the available space.
customer_reviews.author: James West

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for my small trailer spare tire !!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly! Purchased large bulky carrier and it was not only heavier than necessary for my tiny trailer spare tire, it didn't fit - anywhere. So, i bought this thinking it was all i really needed for the small tire and it worked perfect. Went out and bought lock and I'm a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: dmcdaniel

customer_reviews.title: The bracket is adequate, but you will need more parts.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, but it does not include nuts are washers needed for installation, so you will need to make a trip to the hardware store to get the remaining parts to put it on.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy, simple setup.
customer_reviews.text: I live the versatility of this design. You can literally move this anywhere you see for. The locking feature is an added touch. 10min install.
customer_reviews.author: Damien Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Used to mount spare Tire to trailer
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 lug, 13 inch rim and tire that I needed to attach to my trailer. It worked for me! I used anti seize on the threads so I never have to worry about It rusting. Food to have easy access to the spare and it securely locks to the trailer. Much cheaper than other mounts and it does the same thing
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the right size.
customer_reviews.text: I messed up and got a 4" instead of a 3" so it was unusable for me. Seems well made and I guess in a pinch it would work.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything about it. This is my 4th purchase. I use them on my boats and utility trailer. Work great. Keeps the honest guy honest.
customer_reviews.author: J DFreeman

customer_reviews.title: I am ordering something better.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cheap and does not hold the tire vertically. I tried multiple methods but when you go to tighten up the bolts there is a gap that keeps the tire from mounting vertically. Get it only if your funds are extremely limited. As it is it will slip and scratch up the boat trailer. I am ordering something better.
customer_reviews.author: JMD

customer_reviews.title: Simple, but effective
customer_reviews.text: Retains your rim/tire. Works as advertised. Simple construction, but it works and that's what counts.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Hempel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit to hold spare tire.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this to hold a spare tire in my PWC trailer and it was just what I need it. Great quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Del Valle

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: Made a great fit on the trailer of my pontoon boat. Fits spare out of the way. Super easy to install my 13 inch spare. Keeps tire mostly out of water when loading and unloading.
customer_reviews.author: Stanz

customer_reviews.title: Great for roof baskets
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for putting a full size spare tire in my roof basket, not intended purpose but fantastic. I also use a ratchet strap to keep it from wiggling.
customer_reviews.author: Joeylives

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Used it to hold wheel on roof rack. Is doing great..no budge. I did buy 3/8 wingnuts to tighten it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy nuts
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t come with nuts to secure tire, you’d think it would have what you need
customer_reviews.author: Chris Estes

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item, fastest shipping ever, best prices, would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: ... what it says its supposed to and it's a pretty straightforward design
customer_reviews.text: It does do what it says its supposed to and it's a pretty straightforward design. However, I would prefer a little bit different set up or modification, such as a strap and nuts to hold the ubolt on the trailer to fit the tire. It also isn't large enough to fit on my larger trailer due to the combination of tire size and frame width, but it works for my smaller trailer. For the price, it's ok, but the are better options available.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice Spare Tire Holder
customer_reviews.text: Very nice spare tire holder for the money - also ingenious. Used on a Kendon fold-up motorcycle trailer (attached to front tongue). Attached very nicely - put padlock through top to secure - works like a charm. Had some concerns about the simplicity of this unit - but really like how it works and find the simplicity a real positive in this case. Seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Polina

customer_reviews.title: simple and it works
customer_reviews.text: For the price how can you go wrong. I used this to mount a spare tire to the center bar on my trailer. My bar is narrower then this is so I rotated it so it's touching the bar with both verticals to make it more stable. Cranked it down tight and the tire is held in position nicely.
customer_reviews.author: The Cat Family

customer_reviews.title: affordable
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive way to attach spare tire to trailer. Not the fastest, though.
customer_reviews.author: T. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for my 13 inch trailer spare tire (5 lug) that I attached to the boat trailer frame. The tabs act as the nuts to secure the tire and so that a thief can not just lift them straight up off the u-bolt. I really like that I can use my own pad lock that's keyed the same as all my other pad locks and trailer locks. Do not have to carry a bunch of different keys.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap mount
customer_reviews.text: Still holding that spare on tight and I like the fact I can add a lock.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for the money. As I don't expect to have a flat every day, I'm not worried about the length of the bolts. You can cut length to fit, but you'll remove the zinc plating in doing so. The locking feature keeps and honest man honest. The Zinc plating keeps it from corroding. Buy a brass lock. I have another one on my kayak trailer which spends most of its time near salt water. Three years, no problems with corrosion.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin Bob

customer_reviews.title: Holds my spare onto my trailer, easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation, effectively attaches my spare tire to my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Earth For Humanity~

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Now it will at least provide a challange to the thief. Hopefully they will just move to the next guy with no security at all.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy O

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire Mount
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. Super easy to install and it works incredibly well.
customer_reviews.author: Gdog

customer_reviews.title: Makes a thief work harder
customer_reviews.text: Works like advertised. Put your spare tire on the tongue, screw on the two straps, attach your padlock through the overlap holes and you are good to go! Bolt cutters will negate your efforts but if so then the thief is dedicated to his work.
customer_reviews.author: Sedg632

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in my boat trialer for my spare, and have an option to add a lock now if I want.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great idea to secure the spare tire
customer_reviews.text: I have it only for about a month but so far so good. It was easy to install, add a lock and done. Simple and elegant solution to secure the spare tire to a trailer and have a basic security on it.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Escudero

customer_reviews.title: Do not look for more options
customer_reviews.text: The cheapest and smartest way to carry a spare tire on your trailer. and the fastest installation way. Do not look for more options
customer_reviews.author: SARDINE MARINE

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Mounts easily right on a frame member, holds the tire well.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H.

customer_reviews.title: Just attached
customer_reviews.text: Just attached my 10 inch rim/tire to my boat trailer and I am very happy with this carrier. I like the fact that you can lock it if you want. I will probably just stick a zip tie through it for now to keep them from spinning apart. Great system for an add-on tire carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Dan

customer_reviews.title: This was very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install, it took about 5 minutes to bolt the spare onto the trailer, holds nicely.
customer_reviews.author: John Roberts

customer_reviews.title: The threaded part should be longer. I needed to ...
customer_reviews.text: The threaded part should be longer. I needed to add metal plates so my tire/rim wouldn't spin on the frame while moving. Granted this is not a one size fits all, but size rims and trailer frames it will fit should be listed in the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fit my tracker boat trailer perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This fit my Tracker trailer perfectly installed into the carrier without a hitch, pun intended. See photos to see for yourself. Hope this helps. Met my expectations. Excellent purchase. Only 4 stars because I'm stingy and reserve 5 stars for when items exceed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kaptag

customer_reviews.title: Bolts are too short!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure where I went wrong. I have 3x4 frame and a standard 15” trailer wheel and the bolts are too short. Don’t matter which side my wheel is turned. Unusable. It’s tracker pontoon trailer. Based on the description this mount should work. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tonyinsa

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and holds the spare tire securely in place on my boat trailer.
customer_reviews.author: B B 3

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I put this mount on my boat trailer. Piece of cake to install, secures my spare wheel well. I use a lock to prevent theft at boat ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed purchaser
customer_reviews.text: Product description on website was inadequate. Also had short return window. When finally had chance to try to install, found product did not meet trailer mounting needs. And since the 30 day return day had lapsed, am stuck with an item I can't use.
customer_reviews.author: purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for us along with a couple of combination padlocks. 2 allowed me to stack 2 spares bolted securely with the weight on top of the box beam.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Very ingenious idea
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected. I purchased this to support my 13” spare tire on a 5x8 trailer. Very ingenious idea for securing your tire. Once installed, I placed a wooden block behind the tire to prevent the tire from rubbing against the sharp metal edge of the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Gr8Dad

customer_reviews.title: Had to take off.
customer_reviews.text: Squeezed the tire's sidewall against the trailer frame and broke the tire bead after a week. A standoff spacer behind the rim would prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: sequence

customer_reviews.title: Least expensive way to secure spare tire to trailer!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for to securely lock spare tire to trailer frame. Less bulk and weight of other designs. Just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: JoezSB

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: It holds the spare tire good and tight and it is easy to remove. It can also be locked
customer_reviews.author: Alan Steele

customer_reviews.title: The U bolt is nice. It will fit a wide bar on the ...
customer_reviews.text: The U bolt is nice. It will fit a wide bar on the trailer. Easy to mount. It doesn't come with nuts☹️. Not a big deal, but an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hoffman Sr

customer_reviews.title: Pay more for the better one
customer_reviews.text: It is poorly made, treads striped and the way it’s made tire hung to low and hit the ground pulling in or out of driveway
customer_reviews.author: Lost for words

customer_reviews.title: Holding up very well.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Holding up to the salt air so far.
customer_reviews.author: L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Held up when hit hard.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Neighbor borrowed the trailer and bounced the spare tire on something hard enough to put a significant bend in the rim of the spare. The mount got bent up pretty bad, but held on. Will buy another, or rather, my neighbor will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: AKSteve

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: Even though it does the job it is a bit clumsy to turn the two brackets down enough to secure the wheel firmly. Maky work better on a larger wheel than my 13 inch trailer spare.
customer_reviews.author: FAS

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a place to secure a spare tire to a lightweight trailer that I use for transporting a Hobie Cat. The simple design of this mount makes it easy to attach to the trailer without the use of tools. I purchased a Master padlock separately at the local hardware store and was 'up-n-running' in under 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Schumann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a spare tire carrier on roof rack if u got the clearance
customer_reviews.author: Milan

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!
customer_reviews.text: Such a simple idea, and yet so effective. It does take a little bit of time to screw down fasteners, but how often am I going to have to do that? It holds the tire very secure, and I like having the spare available, and out of the way. Very nice product!
customer_reviews.author: E-Rock

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and well designed spare tire carrier.
customer_reviews.text: I used this tire u-bolt to hold a spare tire on to the back side of my spare tire carrier (so I could have two spares) and it worked perfectly. I didn't realize until we got back from our latest trip that I didn't even install a lock and the unit held perfectly tight.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Functional Way to Mount a Spare on a Trailer
customer_reviews.text: This is a little big for my trailer frame (using it on a kayak trailer), but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: DDD

customer_reviews.title: Very simple Spare tire mount that’s lockable
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and effective way to mount a spare tire to a boat trailer
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, best deal for your $$$.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product for years and is good in most, but not all applications but the best deal around for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spare tire attachment
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to use to secure a spare tire on your trailer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for mounting my spare tire on my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo Beach, FL

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy and like it will last for quite a while
customer_reviews.text: Item did exactly what it’s designed to do. We have already installed it and made use of it this weekend. Seems sturdy and like it will last for quite a while. The bolting/connecting system is user friendly and easy to install/uninstall.
customer_reviews.author: Farrah Cone

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and very secure.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Couldn't be easier to install. I got matching locks for my hitch and this tire carrier.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little aggravating ti install and remove, but works well.
customer_reviews.author: jchadwickh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for the spare carrier that was on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: EDR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something simple, cheap & lockable. Presto! With a little finagling I mounted & locked a 14" tire & wheel on my dual axle 6000# boat trailer tongue. Sure, I could have fabricated my own, but not for $10 or even close.
customer_reviews.author: Aubreii Testudo

customer_reviews.title: I would not use this to hold a spare on ...
customer_reviews.text: I would not use this to hold a spare on the outside of my utility trailer. Not as beffy as i though.

customer_reviews.text: Worked well getting the spare tire attached to the tongue of the trailer and out of the way.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive choice to mount a spare but the U bolt ...
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive choice to mount a spare but the U bolt is too short to fit the frame of my trailer and wheel.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: a little wide and long, but worked
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered for a small trailer with a 2" wide beam. I was able to put some wood on the sides and bottom and it has worked perfectly. Seems to be holding up to elements very well. Still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: MarkUJax

customer_reviews.title: Good way to safeguard your spare trailer tire and rim.
customer_reviews.text: This is just the ticket for attaching a spare tire and rim to a trailer tongue. The locking feature makes it a secure means of mounting, and should discourage thieves looking for an easy target.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended & was easy to install on jet ski trailer.

customer_reviews.text: very easy to use ,took out off package mounted tire on trailer tongue in couple minutes,

customer_reviews.text: Doesn't even come with the bolts required to attach. Seriously.

customer_reviews.text: Simple to attach, but bends fairly easily. I came off a curb slowly and the tire hit the curbing and bent it back quite easily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to used and holds tire and makes it lockable.

customer_reviews.text: Works. On my 8" wheels, the design of the nuts are a little large and scrape paint as you tighten it down.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and easy
customer_reviews.text: Great way to attach a spare to a trailer at low cost. Have had it on for a few hundred miles, no issues.

customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Hardware is a little smaller than expected

customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. My boat trailer has a built in basket for the spare tire just behind the tongue. This worked great to secure the spare.

customer_reviews.text: Cheap way to get the spare out of the trailer. Couldn't be easier to mount!

product_meta.title: Attwood 11090-3 U-Bolt Style Tire Carrier, Trailer Tongue or Frame Mount, Fits 4- or 5-Lug Hole Rims, Holds 8-15-Inch Tires
product_meta.description: Size:One sizeThis Attwood U-Bolt Style Tire Carrier makes it easy and convenient to secure a spare tire to a trailer tongue or frame. This square bend U-bolt has threaded brackets that can be locked together (padlock not included). The U-bolt is sturdy and durable zinc-plated steel. The trailer tongue or frame must be between 2 inches x 2 inches square and 3 ½ inches x 4 inches rectangular in size. This carrier holds 4- or 5-lug-hole rims, and with its extra-long 8 ½-inch shaft, it can hold 8-inch to 15-inch tires. Attwood Corporation has been an award-winning leader in engineering, testing, and manufacturing the highest quality marine products for over 100 years. We deliver safe and reliable lighting, fuel systems, water systems, seating & pedestals, swim ladders, custom upholstery, and general marine accessories that are easy to install and meet regulatory compliance.
feature_bullets: An easy and convenient way to secure a spare tire to a trailer tongue or frame
Square bend U-bolt has threaded brackets
Brackets can be locked together (padlock not included)
U-bolt is sturdy and durable zinc-plated steel
Tongue or frame must be between 2 inches square and 3 ½ inches x 4 inches rectangular
Extra-long 8 ½-inch shaft can hold 8-inch to 15-inch tires

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars397 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
